fullPrompt:
[{"role": "system",
  "content":
  "You are a coding assistant who translates from natural language to Lean Theorem Prover code following examples. Follow EXACTLY the examples given."},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "Any conditionally complete linearly ordered field is archimedean. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : ConditionallyCompleteLinearOrderedField α], Archimedean α"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "If two rings are isomorphic, and the second is a domain, then so is the first. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {A : Type u_1} (B : Type u_2) [inst : Ring A] [inst_1 : Ring B] [inst_2 : IsDomain B], A ≃+* B → IsDomain A"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "A field extension is integral if it is finite. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ (K : Type u_1) (L : Type u_2) [inst : Field K] [inst_1 : Field L] [inst_2 : Algebra K L]\n  [inst_3 : FiniteDimensional K L], Algebra.IsIntegral K L"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "All ideals in a division (semi)ring are trivial. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {K : Type u} [inst : DivisionSemiring K] (I : Ideal K), I = ⊥ ∨ I = ⊤"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "A finite field has prime power cardinality. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : Fintype α] [inst_1 : Field α], IsPrimePow (Fintype.card α)"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "A subring contains the ring's 0. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content": "∀ {R : Type u} [inst : Ring R] (s : Subring R), 0 ∈ s"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "The characteristic of a finite ring cannot be zero. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ (R : Type u_1) [inst : NonAssocRing R] (p : ℕ) [inst : CharP R p] [inst : Finite R], p ≠ 0"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "Stalks of a locally ringed space are local rings. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ (self : AlgebraicGeometry.LocallyRingedSpace) (x : ↑↑self.toPresheafedSpace),\n  LocalRing ↑(TopCat.Presheaf.stalk self.presheaf x)"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "The quotient of a ring by an ideal is a field iff the ideal is maximal. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {R : Type u} [inst : CommRing R] (I : Ideal R), Ideal.IsMaximal I ↔ IsField (R ⧸ I)"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "The category of rings has all limits. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "CategoryTheory.Limits.HasLimitsOfSize.{v, v, max u v, max (u + 1) (v + 1)} CommSemiRingCatMax"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "Every ring involution must be its own inverse "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {F : Type u_1} {R : outParam (Type u_2)} [inst : Semiring R] [self : RingInvoClass F R] (f : F) (x : R),\n  MulOpposite.unop (↑f (MulOpposite.unop (↑f x))) = x"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "Any infinite type can be endowed a field structure. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content": "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Infinite α], Nonempty (Field α)"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "For a semiring to be a field, it must have two distinct elements. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content": "∀ {R : Type u} [inst : Semiring R], IsField R → ∃ x y, x ≠ y"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "When a ring is not a field, the maximal ideals are nontrivial. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommSemiring R] [inst_1 : Nontrivial R] {M : Ideal R}, Ideal.IsMaximal M → ¬IsField R → M ≠ ⊥"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "A linear ordered field that is a floor ring is archimedean. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ (α : Type u_1) [inst : LinearOrderedField α] [inst_1 : FloorRing α], Archimedean α"},
 {"role": "user", "conte
